sparse.eigenvolvers.java

Class Lobpcg

  • java.lang.Object
    • sparse.eigenvolvers.java.SparseEigensolver
      • sparse.eigenvolvers.java.Lobpcg

  • public class Lobpcg
extends SparseEigensolver
    SPARSE-EIG Java Lobpcg class.

    SPARSE-EIG uses the MTJ Java library (matrix-toolkits-java) and Netlib Java (netlib-java) for numerical linear algebra and matrix computations.

    This algorithm is based on BLOPEX (Block Locally Optimal Preconditioned Eigenvalue Xolvers, see [1]). This Java implementation is called Lobpcg (Locally Optimal Block Preconditioned Conjugate Gradient Method) and computes a set of the smallest eigenvalues lambda and corresponding eigenvectors X of the generalized eigenproblem A*x=lambda B*x, where Hermitian operators A and B are given, as well as an optional preconditioner, T. The operators B and T must, in addition, be positive definite. B is optional and if it is not provided the standard eigenvalue problem A*x=lambda*x is solved. To compute the largest eigenpairs of A, simply apply the code to A multiplied by -1. The code does not involve any matrix factorizations of A and B. The matrices A, B and T may be provided as dense or compressed row matrices or as an operator function provided in a completely flexible way by the user.

    If a dense matrix Y is provided then the search is done in the orthogonal (B-orthogonal if B is given) complement of the column-space of Y.

    The arguments residualTolerance and maxIterations control the residual tolerance and maximum number of steps, and verbosityLevel = 0, 1, or >1 controls the amount of printed information. The eigenvalue history of all iterative lambdas, and the residual norms history of residuals can be obtained using the SparseEigensolver.getEigenvalueHistory() and SparseEigensolver.getResidualNormsHistory() methods after runLobpcg(Object...) is run.

    This code does not compute all eigenvalues. It is designed to compute no more than ~20%, and attempting to compute more that 20% of the eigenpairs may cause the code to crash.

    For background see [1], [2] and [3] below. The interface and structure of the code functionality is very similar to lobpcg.m, the Matlab version [2].

    Example of use:
    See runLobpcg(Object...) for details concerning parameters. 

    Example with all possible arguments:
runLobpcg(X,A,B,T,Y,residualTolerance,maxIterations,verbosityLevel)

Example of just one argument (solves A*x=lambda*x):
In this case starting vectors for the initial subspace are generated randomly and the 
default block size is used.
lobpcg.runLobpcg(A);

Example of just two arguments (solves A*x=lambda*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A);

Example of X, A, tol, maxit, verb (solves A*x=lambda*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A,1e-5,50,1);

Example of X, A, B, tol, maxit, verb (solves A*x=lambda*B*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A,B,1e-5,50,1);

Example of no B or T, but there is constraint matrix Y (solves A*x=lambda*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A,null,null,Y,1e-5,50,1);

Example of no B but there is preconditioner T (solves A*x=lambda*x):
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,A,null,T);
    References:
    [1] A. V. Knyazev, I. Lashuk, M. E. Argentati, and E. Ovchinnikov, Block Locally Optimal Preconditioned Eigenvalue Xolvers (BLOPEX) in hypre and PETSc, SIAM Journal on Scientific Computing (SISC), Vol. 29 (2007), No. 5, pp. 2224-2239.
    [2] Lobpcg solves Hermitian partial generalized eigenproblems using preconditioning - Lobpcg (MATLAB)
    [3] C-version of Lobpcg -     Blopex
    Author:
    Rico Argentati

    • Method Detail

      • runLobpcg

        public int runLobpcg(java.lang.Object... args)
        Method for running Lobpcg with input arguments.
        Example with all possible arguments:
        runLobpcg(X,A,B,T,Y,residualTolerance,maxIterations,verbosityLevel)
        Parameters:
        blockVectorX - initial approximation to eigenvectors, dense matrix (n-by-blockSize). X must be full rank. Note that in place of X, the blocksize may be given, then the X is generated by lobpcg randomly.
        operA - the operator of the problem, can be given as a dense matrix, compressed row matrix or as a user defined operator (function). operA, operB and operT conceptually implement a matrix vector multiply, but this can be done as a function, where operA, operB and operT are n x n operators.
        Optional input:
        operB - the second operator, can be given as a dense matrix, compressed row matrix or as an operator
        operT - the preconditioner, can be given as a dense matrix, compressed row matrix or as an operator. T should be a approximation to the inverse of A to solve A*x=lambda*x
        blockVectorY - constraints input, is a dense matrix. The iterations will be performed in the orthogonal (B-orthogonal if B is given) complement of the column-space of Y. Y must be full rank and have n rows.
        residualTolerance - default is n*sqrt(eps)
        maxIterations - default is min(n,20)
        verbosityLevel - default is 1 (0 - no output, 1 standard output, >1 verbose output)

        Note: if there is a T, but no B use null as place holder for B. If there is a Y, but no B or T use place holder(s) null.

        Returns:
        convergence status (1 if converged, -1 if did not converge)

      • runLobpcg

        public int runLobpcg()
        Method for running lobpcg using set methods. Use subset of desired SparseEigensolver set methods to set up parameters. Then run method runLobpcg().
        SparseEigensolver.setBlockSize(int blockSize)
        SparseEigensolver.setBlockVectorX(DenseMatrix blockVectorX)
        SparseEigensolver.setA(DenseMatrix A)
        SparseEigensolver.setA(CompRowMatrix A)
        SparseEigensolver.setA(Operator A)
        SparseEigensolver.setB(DenseMatrix B)
        SparseEigensolver.setB(CompRowMatrix B)
        SparseEigensolver.setB(Operator B)
        SparseEigensolver.setT(DenseMatrix T)
        SparseEigensolver.setT(CompRowMatrix T)
        SparseEigensolver.setT(Operator T)
        SparseEigensolver.setBlockVectorY(DenseMatrix blockVectorY)
        SparseEigensolver.setMaxIterations(int maxIterations)
        SparseEigensolver.setResidualTolerance(double residualTolerance)
        SparseEigensolver.setVerbosityLevel(int verbosityLevel)
        Returns:
        convergence status (1 if converged, -1 if did not converge)
